intro: Schnella mutisii, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. It typically grows in high-altitude regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. The leaves are heart-shaped and covered in a fine, soft down, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
